DataElement.preferredDefinition: extent of nodal involvement determined prior to treatment based on evidence obtained from removal of the regional lymph nodes adequate to validate the absence of regional lymph node metastasis and sufficient to evaluate the highest category.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to pathologic N stage of a breast tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the pathologic N (nodal) stage of a breast tumor, as defined by the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, 6th Ed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No regional lymph node metastasis histologically, no additional examination for isolated tumor cells (ITC)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No regional lymph node metastasis histologically, no additional examination for isolated tumor cells (ITC)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No regional lymph node metastasis histologically, no additional examination for isolated tumor cells (ITC) Note: ITCs are defined as single tumor cells or small cell clusters !U0.2 mm, usually detected only by immunohistochemical (IHC) or molecular methods but that may be verified on hematoloxylin & eosin (H&E) stains. ITCs do not usually show evidence of malignant activity, e.g., proliferation or stromal reaction.]

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: N2a Stage Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: N2a Stage Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases in several regional lymph nodes.  The definition of N2a TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm); for cutaneous melanoma it refers to micrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes; for colorectal cancer it refers to metastases in 4-6 regional lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases in several regional lymph nodes.  The definition of N2a TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm); for cutaneous melanoma it refers to micrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes; for colorectal cancer it refers to metastases in 4-6 regional lymph nodes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: N1a Stage Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: N1a Stage Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases usually in a limited number of regional lymph nodes. The definition of N1a TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm); for cutaneous melanoma it refers to micrometastasis in one regional lymph node; for colorectal cancer it refers to metastasis in one regional lymph node.

Concepts.definition: A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases usually in a limited number of regional lymph nodes. The definition of N1a TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm); for cutaneous melanoma it refers to micrometastasis in one regional lymph node; for colorectal cancer it refers to metastasis in one regional lymph node.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: N0 Stage Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: N0 Stage Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A regional lymph node TNM finding indicating that there is no evidence of regional lymph node metastasis.

Concepts.definition: A regional lymph node TNM finding indicating that there is no evidence of regional lymph node metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
